title: The Heart of Mid-Lothian, Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The late Dr. Fullartonof Rosemount, in the neighbourhood of Ayr, being well acquainted with herfather when in England, endeavoured, in a severe season, by every meansin his power, to detain her at Rosemount for a few days until the weathershould become more mild; but when she found herself rested a little, andsaw her sheep fed, she raised her crook, which was the signal she alwaysgave for the sheep to follow her, and off they all marched together.

title: The Heart of Mid-Lothian, Volume 2
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The late Dr. Fullartonof Rosemount, in the neighbourhood of Ayr, being well acquainted with herfather when in England, endeavoured, in a severe season, by every meansin his power, to detain her at Rosemount for a few days until the weathershould become more mild; but when she found herself rested a little, andsaw her sheep fed, she raised her crook, which was the signal she alwaysgave for the sheep to follow her, and off they all marched together.

title: Autobiography of Mrs. Fletcher.
author: Fletcher
snippet: I meantime proceeded with Mr. and Mrs. Wright to Perth, and took up my residence again at the house of my friends Mr. and Mrs. Meliss, at their pleasant  villa of Rosemount, near that place.

title: Autobiography of Mrs. Fletcher.
author: Fletcher
snippet: My uncle William Dawson, my cousin John, and I, set out on this excursion on the 23d of July, and after a visit of three weeks to my friend Mrs. Meliss at Rosemount, a pretty villa near Perth, where I witnessed much domestic happiness and received much kindly hospitality, we proceeded through Perthshire and Argyllshire by the ordinary tourist route, and, returning  by the Westmoreland and Cumberland lakes, we completed  our expedition by the 5th of October, on which day we returned to Oxton.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Thelate Dr. Fullarton of Rosemount, in the neighbourhood of Ayr, being well acquainted with her father,when in England, endeavoured, in a severe season,by every means in his power to detain her at Rosemount for a few days until the weather should become more mild; but when she found herself resteda little, and saw her sheep fed, she raised her crook,which was the signal she always gave for the sheepto follow her, and off they all marched together.

title: Romance of War ... New edition
author: Grant, James
snippet: Under its new nameof Rosemount, Lochisla was advertised for sale, at a small upset price,and all applications were to be made to Messrs. Diddle and Fleece, at theiroffice in Queen Street.

title: Romance of War ... New edition
author: Grant, James
snippet: 'Any person or persons found trespassing on the lands of RosemountTower, will be punished with the utmost rigour of the law by the Proprietor, Zachary Macquabester, Esq., of Rosemount.
